Drop last facets of array

Source: R/tab.R
dropLast.Rd

Primarily used to strips totals from a table bordered by totals by dropping the last facet.

Usage

dropLast(arr, drop = FALSE, keep = NULL)

Arguments

arr

array

drop

drop parameter in subsetting, default FALSE

keep

names of facets to be kept, default NULL

Examples

(arr <- array(1:24,2:4))
#> , , 1
#> 
#>      [,1] [,2] [,3]
#> [1,]    1    3    5
#> [2,]    2    4    6
#> 
#> , , 2
#> 
#>      [,1] [,2] [,3]
#> [1,]    7    9   11
#> [2,]    8   10   12
#> 
#> , , 3
#> 
#>      [,1] [,2] [,3]
#> [1,]   13   15   17
#> [2,]   14   16   18
#> 
#> , , 4
#> 
#>      [,1] [,2] [,3]
#> [1,]   19   21   23
#> [2,]   20   22   24
#> 
arr %>% dropLast
#> , , 1
#> 
#>      [,1] [,2]
#> [1,]    1    3
#> 
#> , , 2
#> 
#>      [,1] [,2]
#> [1,]    7    9
#> 
#> , , 3
#> 
#>      [,1] [,2]
#> [1,]   13   15
#> 
arr %>% dropLast(drop = TRUE)
#>      [,1] [,2] [,3]
#> [1,]    1    7   13
#> [2,]    3    9   15
tab(iris, ~ Species)
#> Species
#>     setosa versicolor  virginica      Total 
#>         50         50         50        150 
tab(iris, ~ Species) %>% dropLast 
#> Species
#>     setosa versicolor  virginica 
#>         50         50         50 
tab(iris, ~ Species + I(Sepal.Length > 5)) %>% dropLast 
#>             I(Sepal.Length > 5)
#> Species      FALSE TRUE
#>   setosa        28   22
#>   versicolor     3   47
#>   virginica      1   49
# row percentages:
tab(iris, ~ Species + I(Sepal.Length > 5), pct= 1)
#>             I(Sepal.Length > 5)
#> Species          FALSE      TRUE     Total
#>   setosa      56.00000  44.00000 100.00000
#>   versicolor   6.00000  94.00000 100.00000
#>   virginica    2.00000  98.00000 100.00000
#>   All         21.33333  78.66667 100.00000
tab(iris, ~ Species + I(Sepal.Length > 5), pct= 1) %>% dropLast
#>             I(Sepal.Length > 5)
#> Species      FALSE TRUE
#>   setosa        56   44
#>   versicolor     6   94
#>   virginica      2   98
tab(iris, ~ Species + I(Sepal.Length > 5), pct= 1) %>% dropLast(keep = "All")
#>             I(Sepal.Length > 5)
#> Species         FALSE     TRUE
#>   setosa     56.00000 44.00000
#>   versicolor  6.00000 94.00000
#>   virginica   2.00000 98.00000
#>   All        21.33333 78.66667
